intro: Flexanthera subcordata, commonly known as the pink fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure consists of two opposing lobes that open to reveal a showy interior. Flexanthera subcordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
